channel.title: How does my PC stack up in 2011/2012
channel.description:
Hello I'm wondering how well my PC will stack up against newer PC's in 2011/2012?
Ram:Corsair XMS3 4GB 1333mhz CPU: Core I7 860 2.8ghz (soon to be overclocked) ^_^ GPU: Zotac Gtx 580 (May 2011) Harddrive: Western Digital Caviar Black 1TB Power supply: Thermaltake toughpower 1000 watt Case: Cooler Master HAF 932 (Original 2008 version) Motherboard: Asus Maximus Formula iii Heatsink: Cooler Master V8 Sound card: on board Asus Supreme fx II

item.title: How does my PC stack up in 2011/2012
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Upgrading from a 5870 to another single gpu would be pointless now-- I looked into it myself thoroughly since I have a 5870, and the GTX 580 isn’t that much more powerful, especially not enough to justify the price of upgrading.

The only reason I’d exchange my 5870 for another card would be for two 6950s so I could crossfire them. That would give a good performance increase, especially since one 6950 performs a little better than a 5870 by itself, and crossfires significantly better (and isn’t too much more expensive).

Read full topic
item.source: How does my PC stack up in 2011/2012

item.title: How does my PC stack up in 2011/2012

item.title: How does my PC stack up in 2011/2012
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Haha I’m going to wait as long as I can to get a new graphics card. BF3 is the only game in recent memory that’s challenged my card (besides GTAIV with enb mods but that doesn’t count). Besides, I’m happy with 40 FPS.

Read full topic
item.source: How does my PC stack up in 2011/2012

item.title: How does my PC stack up in 2011/2012
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
Kairouseki:

I can hardly run BF3 at 40 FPS with my i5 760 @3.5GHz, 8GB RAM, and HD 5870 .

I may be mistaken, but a simple exchange for a more presumptuous graphics card shall leave ye gleeful.

Read full topic

item.title: How does my PC stack up in 2011/2012
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
djMDK:

Ever considered getting a sound card?
Hows the on board sound compared though?
When I transferred form on board to sound card, the sound was much better and crisper, but then again the on mobo was from like 04’,05’ best buy dell all in one.

To be realistic, there´s not much difference if any at all from integrated sound chips from 05 to now

Read full topic
